FastAPI Responses


Find HTTPExceptions and turn them into documented responses. :tada:

## Installation``` bashpip install fastapi-responses```## UsageThe simplest use case happens when we have a single exception being raised. We don't want to document the possible response manually, so **FastAPI Responses** comes in handy.``` pythonfrom fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPExceptionfrom fastapi_responses import custom_openapiapp = FastAPI()app.openapi = custom_openapi(app)@app.get("/{item_id}")def get_item(item_id: int): if item_id == 0: raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Item not found.") return "Item exists!"```### Without FastAPI Responses### With FastAPI Responses## Roadmap- [X] Extract HTTPException from stack.- [ ] Extract any exception and document based on the `exception_handler` container.- [ ] Accept Python objects on `HTTPException` instantiation.## LicenseThis project is licensed under the terms of the MIT license.
